title: Summer Pepper Salad Recipe
description: This is a great salad for the summer heat. It is light and very quick to make. And even my kids like it. Serve with French bread for a great combination.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Vegetable Salad Recipes Summer Pepper Salad 4.3 (30) 25 Reviews 7 Photos This is a great salad for the summer heat. It is light and very quick to make. And even my kids like it. Serve with French bread for a great combination. Submitted by barbzal Updated on January 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 7 7 7 7 Prep Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped 1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped 1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and chopped 1 medium cucumber, seeded and chopped ¼ cup chopped fresh parsley 8 ounces crumbled feta cheese 1 tablespoon olive oil Directions In a large bowl, mix the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, cucumber, parsley, feta cheese, and olive oil. Chill at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator before serving. I Made It Print 41 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 212 Calories 16g Fat 9g Carbs 9g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 212 % Daily Value * Total Fat 16g 20% Saturated Fat 9g 45% Cholesterol 51mg 17% Sodium 639mg 28% Total Carbohydrate 9g 3% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Total Sugars 6g Protein 9g 19% Vitamin C 123mg 137% Calcium 301mg 23% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 307mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Summer Pepper Salad 01 of 07 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 07 Photo by  Joanne Kent 06/21/2019 03 of 07 Photo by  QueenButterfly 11/06/2014 04 of 07 Photo by  Sarah Humphrey 04/26/2014 Refreshing salad idea! I added the balsamic vinegar suggested by Sarah Jo- great tip. 05 of 07 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 06/27/2012 06 of 07 Photo by  bellydancer 06/01/2009 I would have to rate this a five, even though I added way less feta and a splash of balsamic vinegar. I'm sure I would love it with all of the feta, but I'm trying to eat lighter and healthier. I didn't have a yellow pepper, but will definitely add it next time! 1 You’ll Also Love Spicy Italian Salad 127 Ratings Fatoosh 149 Ratings Rice, Asparagus and Cucumber Salad 68 Ratings Summer Bean Salad II 32 Ratings Super Easy Spinach and Red Pepper Salad 91 Ratings Blackberry Spinach Salad 118 Ratings Moroccan Cooked Pepper Salad 24 Ratings Kristi's Corn Salad 33 Ratings Easy Rainbow Pasta Salad 172 Ratings Three Pepper Pasta Salad 61 Ratings Garden Pasta Salad 508 Ratings Summer Pasta Salad I 26 Ratings Corn Salad 54 Ratings Cilantro Tomato Corn Salad 171 Ratings Mexican Corn Salad 48 Ratings Black-Eyed Pea Salad 134 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: barbzal
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the green bell pepper, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, cucumber, parsley, feta cheese, and olive oil. Chill at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator before serving.
